    • Uses of Vector3d in fast3d

      Methods in fast3d that return Vector3d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector3d Panel3d.get3dScreenPoint(int x, int y)
      for a given coordinate on the Panel3d the 3d point in the universe is returned that is on the screen at the transformed given screen position
      Vector3d Renderable.getPos()
      should not return null
      should return a reference (should not must)
      Vector3d[] Renderable.getVertices()
      should return every vertex used during render() to accelerate the shading and rendering
      a renderable is requested to return all its vertices here
      may return null if no vertices are used for whatever reason or the vertices are not known yet
      Vector3d Renderable.rayTrace(Vector3d s, Vector3d r)
      for 3d-clicks on a panel3d or some lighting/shadowing calculation it is important to determine whether a renderable has some puncture point with a ray
      may return null
      Methods in fast3d that return types with arguments of type Vector3d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> Panel3d.pick(int x, int y)
      used to pick all Renderables by click on the panel
      may return null if rayTracing is not supported by the universe or no Renderable was detected
      works like a 3d-click
      Methods in fast3d with parameters of type Vector3d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector3d Renderable.rayTrace(Vector3d s, Vector3d r)
      for 3d-clicks on a panel3d or some lighting/shadowing calculation it is important to determine whether a renderable has some puncture point with a ray
      may return null

      a scene is targeted if any of its objects is targeted
      Vector3d Object.rayTrace(Vector3d rayOrig, Vector3d rayDir)
      an object is targeted if any of its groups is targeted
      does not necessarily return the nearest to rayOrig puncture point
      Vector3d Group.rayTrace(Vector3d rayOrig, Vector3d rayDir)
      a group is targeted if any of its triangles is targeted
      does not necessarily return the nearest to rayOrig puncture point

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Hashtable<Object,Vector3d> Scene.getRelativePositions()
      calculates the difference-vector from this position to the positions of the objects
      java.util.Hashtable<Group,Vector3d> Object.getRelativePositions()
      calculates the difference-vector from this position to the positions of the groups
      java.util.Hashtable<Triangle,Vector3d> Group.getRelativePositions()
      calculates the difference-vector from this position to the positions of the triangles
      java.util.Set<Vector3d> Scene.getVerticesOnce()
      a wrapper to getVertices() removing all double-entries of a vertex so that it is only once in the result-set
      java.util.Set<Vector3d> Object.getVerticesOnce()
      a wrapper to getVertices() removing all double-entries of a vertex so that it is only once in the result-set
      java.util.Set<Vector3d> Group.getVerticesOnce()
      a wrapper to getVertices() removing all double-entries of a vertex so that it is only once in the result-set
      java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> Universe.rayTrace(Vector3d s, Vector3d r)
      1)on a picking-action on the holding panel3d this method is called to determine, which Renderables may be targeted
      2)on a lighting-calculation the lighting-method will call rayTrace to determine whether some rays of light my be obstructed and now some objects lay in the shadow
      this method should call rayTrace for every Renderable that is in the universes internal storage and list the Renderables which return not null from that method in a result-list
      Methods in fast3d.complex with parameters of type Vector3d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Scene.lookInDirection(Vector3d dir, Vector3d up)
      rotates in the way that the new forward vector will be parallel to the parameter dir and the new up vector will be parallel to the parameter up
      dir and up should be orthogonal
      void Object.lookInDirection(Vector3d dir, Vector3d up)
      rotates in the way that the new forward vector will be parallel to the parameter dir and the new up vector will be parallel to the parameter up
      dir and up should be orthogonal
      void Group.lookInDirection(Vector3d dir, Vector3d up)
      rotates in the way that the new forward vector will be parallel to the parameter dir and the new up vector will be parallel to the parameter up
      dir and up should be orthogonal
      void Scene.moveInAbsoluteDirection(Vector3d dir)
      moves all objects along the given vector and the position-vector too
      void Object.moveInAbsoluteDirection(Vector3d dir)
      moves the position-pointer and all groups in the given axis-aligned direction
      void Group.moveInAbsoluteDirection(Vector3d dir)
      translates all Triangles along the given vector and the position-vector too
      void Scene.moveTo(Vector3d target)
      moves along the difference-vector from getPos() to target
      void Object.moveTo(Vector3d target)
      moves along the difference-vector from getPos() to target
      void Group.moveTo(Vector3d target)
      moves in the absolute direction of the difference vector from the current position to the target
      void VertexAction.perform(Vector3d vertex)
      to manipulate the given vertex
      java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> Universe.rayTrace(Vector3d s, Vector3d r)
      1)on a picking-action on the holding panel3d this method is called to determine, which Renderables may be targeted
      2)on a lighting-calculation the lighting-method will call rayTrace to determine whether some rays of light my be obstructed and now some objects lay in the shadow
      this method should call rayTrace for every Renderable that is in the universes internal storage and list the Renderables which return not null from that method in a result-list
      Vector3d Scene.rayTrace(Vector3d rayOrig, Vector3d rayDir)
      a scene is targeted if any of its objects is targeted
      Vector3d Object.rayTrace(Vector3d rayOrig, Vector3d rayDir)
      an object is targeted if any of its groups is targeted
      does not necessarily return the nearest to rayOrig puncture point
      Vector3d Group.rayTrace(Vector3d rayOrig, Vector3d rayDir)
      a group is targeted if any of its triangles is targeted
      does not necessarily return the nearest to rayOrig puncture point
      void RenderAction.render(Vector3d pos, Graphics3d g)
      called when the render-action should draw something
      void Scene.rot(Vector3d axis, double rad)
      on any rotation, also either a translation and rotation of any object is performed
      void Object.rot(Vector3d axis, double rad)
      on any rotation, also either a translation and rotation of any group is performed
      void Group.rot(Vector3d axis, double rad)
      on any rotation, also either a translation and rotation of any triangles is performed
      void Scene.setForwardVector(Vector3d f)
      the forward-vector has to be orthogonal to the up-vector
      void Object.setForwardVector(Vector3d f)
      the forward-vector has to be orthogonal to the up-vector
      void Group.setForwardVector(Vector3d f)
      the forward-vector has to be orthogonal to the up-vector

      Vector3d DirectionalLight.direction
      the directional-light direction
      Vector3d PointLight.pos
      the position of this light-source in the universe
      Methods in fast3d.complex.light that return Vector3d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector3d DirectionalLight.directionOfLight()
      for all Illuminatables in space, this will be the same
      returns a reference
      Vector3d PointLight.directionOfLight(Illuminatable r)
      for every Illuminatable in space, this will be different because of it's relative position to this light-source
      abstract Vector3d ObstructableLight.directionOfLight(Illuminatable l)
      any obstructable light has to have a direction of it's light-rays
      Vector3d DirectionalLight.directionOfLight(Illuminatable l) 
      Vector3d Illuminatable.getNormal()
      needed for some aligned lighting calculation like diffusive light or specular light may return null
      Vector3d PointLight.getPos() 
      abstract Vector3d ObstructableLight.getPos()
      to calculate all Renderables between the currently to illuminate Illuminatable and the light source using ray tracing it it necessary to create a ray out if the lights position to not consider renderables behind the light (from the currently to illuminate Illuminatable) as being in front of the light
      Vector3d DirectionalLight.getPos() 
      Methods in fast3d.complex.light that return types with arguments of type Vector3d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> ObstructableLight.obstructings(Illuminatable l)
      should be used by illuminate(Illuminatable) to determine whether the Illuminatable to currently illuminate lays in the shadow of another
      Constructors in fast3d.complex.light with parameters of type Vector3d 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectionalLight(Universe uni, Color c, Vector3d dir)
      for illuminating it has to be calculated, whether an Illuminatable lays in the shadow of another
      PointLight(Universe uni, Color c, Vector3d pos)
      because this sort of light is located, it may be obstructed and cause shadow behind a Renderable
      SpecularLight(Universe uni, Color c, Vector3d dir)
      constructs a new shiny light

    • Uses of Vector3d in fast3d.graphics

      Methods in fast3d.graphics with parameters of type Vector3d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Graphics3d.drawString(java.lang.String text, Vector3d pos)
      shades the given vertex and uses the pixel to determine where to draw a 2d-string on the screen
      works just fine for call-outs, remember the text will be not 3d
      void Graphics3d.line(Vector3d start, Vector3d end)
      shades the vertices and draws a line from one of these pixels to the other
      works like drawing a 3d-line
      void Graphics3d.pixel(Vector3d pos)
      shades the given vertex and sets the pixel to the previous set color by setColor(Color)
      works like drawing a 3d-pixel
      void Graphics3d.pixel(Vector3d pos, int width)
      shades the given vertex and sets the pixel to the previous set color by setColor(Color)
      works like drawing a 3d-pixel
      void Graphics3d.polygon(Vector3d... ps)
      shades all vertices using shadeAll() and draws a polygon over these pixels (filled if wireFrameMode is false)
      works like drawing a 3d-polygon (should be not too big in complex sceneries) if wireframeMode is on(true), a polygon is just a polyline where the first and last point are equal
      void Graphics3d.polyline(Vector3d... ps)
      shades all vertices using shadeAll() and draws a polyline over these
      works like drawing a 3d-polyline (should be not too big in complex sceneries)
      if wireframeMode is on(true), a polygon is just a polyline where the first and last point are equal
      Vector2d Graphics3d.shade(Vector3d v)
      converts one given vertex in pixel-coordinates
      faster than getShader().shade(vertices) because of buffering-features
      if a vertex is shaded to null according to the camera-mode-settings, this method will return null too
      java.util.List<Vector2d> Graphics3d.shadeAll(Vector3d... vecs)
      converts all given vertices in pixel-coordinates
      faster than getShader().shade(vertices) because of buffering-features
      if a vertex is shaded to null according to the camera-mode-settings, it won't be added to the return-list
      void Turtle3d.tmove(Vector3d dir)
      moves the turtle relative to it's position and rotation: if the turtle looks to the right than it will go to the right on call tmove(Vector3d.forward())
      if the pen is down then draw a line from current position to the new position
      void Turtle3d.tmoveTo(Vector3d newpos)
      moves the turtle to the absolute position given and remains it rotation
      if the pen is down then draw a line from current position to the new position
      Method parameters in fast3d.graphics with type arguments of type Vector3d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Graphics3d.sort(java.util.Map<Vector3d,RenderAction> call)
      sorts the given keys in relation to their position to the camera and then calls the run method for the corresponding value so it can draw something

    • Uses of Vector3d in fast3d.math

      Methods in fast3d.math that return Vector3d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector3d Vector3d.add(Vector3d t)
      adds the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      static Vector3d Vector3d.calculateAverage(Vector3d... vecs)
      the average vector is:
      does not change the parameter
      the center position (if the given vectors were interpreted as positions) the middle-direction (if the given vectors were interpreted as directions)
      Vector3d Vector3d.clone() 
      Vector3d Vector3d.constrain(double min, double max)
      constrains the coordinates to the given range
      if a coordinate is lower than min, it will be set to min
      if a coordinate is higher than max, it will be set to max
      after this method call all coordinates will be within the interval [min,max], including the limits
      Vector3d Vector3d.constrainLength(double min, double max)
      constrains the length to the given range
      if this length is lower than min, it will be scaled to min
      if this length is higher than max, it will be scaled to max
      Vector3d Vector3d.crossP(Vector3d b)
      the cross-product of two vectors is a vector that is orthogonal to the parameters
      it does matter in which order the parameters are given.
      static Vector3d Vector3d.crossP(Vector3d a, Vector3d b)
      the cross-product of two vectors is a vector that is orthogonal to the parameters
      it does matter in which order the parameters are given.
      static Vector3d Vector3d.forward() 
      Vector3d Camera.getLookDir() 
      Vector3d Camera.getPos()
      should definitely cloned for calculations
      Vector3d Camera.getScreenDiagon() 
      Vector3d Camera.getScreenHeight()
      should definitely be cloned for calculations
      Vector3d Camera.getScreenOrig()
      should definitely cloned for calculations
      Vector3d Camera.getScreenWidth()
      should definitely be cloned for calculations
      Vector3d Camera.getUpVector() 
      Vector3d Vector3d.invert()
      inverts this vector
      this will point in the opposite direction, but with the same length
      Vector3d Vector3d.multiply(Vector3d t)
      multiplies the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector3d Vector3d.normalize()
      scales the vector to the length 1
      fails (does nothing than) for the zero-vector
      static Vector3d Vector3d.one() 
      static Vector3d Vector3d.random() 
      static Vector3d Vector3d.random2dxy() 
      static Vector3d Vector3d.random2dxz() 
      static Vector3d Vector3d.random2dyz() 
      static Vector3d Vector3d.right() 
      Vector3d Vector3d.rot(Vector3d axis, double rad)
      rotates this vector around the aligned axis in mathematically positive direction
      Vector3d Vector3d.rotX(double rad)
      rotates the vector around the x-axis in mathematically positive direction, means nicking
      mathematically positive means nick up
      Vector3d Vector3d.rotY(double rad)
      rotates the vector around the y-axis in mathematically positive direction, means turning
      mathematically positive means turn left
      Vector3d Vector3d.rotZ(double rad)
      rotates the vector around the z-axis in mathematically positive direction, means leaning
      mathematically positive means counter-clockwise
      Vector3d Vector3d.scale(double k)
      enlarges the vector by k, it's direction will be constant
      for k between 0 and 1, the vector will be shortened
      for negative k the vector will be inverted and then enlarged by positive k
      Vector3d Vector3d.scaleTo(double length)
      scales this vector to the length of the parameter-vector, but will not change this direction
      Vector3d Vector3d.scaleTo(Vector3d compare)
      scales this vector to the length of the parameter-vector, but will not change this direction
      the parameter will not be changed
      Vector3d Vector3d.set(double x, double y, double z)
      copies the coordinates of the parameter to this
      Vector3d Vector3d.set(Vector3d t)
      copies the coordinates of the parameter to this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector3d Vector3d.setCoordinates(double[] vec)
      counterpart to getCoordinates
      sets the coordinates of this to x=[0], y=[1], z=[2]
      Vector3d Vector3d.setToZero()
      sets all coordinates to 0
      Vector3d Vector3d.sub(Vector3d t)
      subtracts the coordinates of the parameter from the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector3d Vector3d.to(Vector3d t)
      does not change the parameter
      Vector3d Vector3d.toCartesian()
      converts this vectors polar coordinates (x=inclination (theta), y=azimuth (phi), z=distance) to Cartesian coordinates toCartesian().toPolar() should cause no change unless a rounding mistake
      Vector3d Vector3d.toPolar()
      converts this vectors Cartesian coordinates to polar coordinates
      a polar coordinates representation is given by two angles (new x-coordinate as inclination (theta), new y-coordinate as azimuth (phi)) and a distance (new z-coordinate) from the coordinate-center toPolar().toCartesian() should cause no change unless a rounding mistake
      static Vector3d Vector3d.up() 
      static Vector3d Vector3d.x()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as x-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      static Vector3d Vector3d.y()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as y-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      static Vector3d Vector3d.z()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as z-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      static Vector3d Vector3d.zero() 
      Methods in fast3d.math with parameters of type Vector3d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector3d Vector3d.add(Vector3d t)
      adds the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      double Vector3d.angleTo(Vector3d v)
      calculates the angle between this and the parameter-vector in radiant
      both vectors are direction-vectors and for that calculation interpreted as arrows laying on the 3d-space-origin
      does not change the parameter
      static Vector3d Vector3d.calculateAverage(Vector3d... vecs)
      the average vector is:
      does not change the parameter
      the center position (if the given vectors were interpreted as positions) the middle-direction (if the given vectors were interpreted as directions)
      Vector3d Vector3d.crossP(Vector3d b)
      the cross-product of two vectors is a vector that is orthogonal to the parameters
      it does matter in which order the parameters are given.
      static Vector3d Vector3d.crossP(Vector3d a, Vector3d b)
      the cross-product of two vectors is a vector that is orthogonal to the parameters
      it does matter in which order the parameters are given.
      double Vector3d.distanceTo(Vector3d target)
      calculates the length of the difference vector given by to(target)
      does not change the parameter
      double Vector3d.distanceToSquared(Vector3d target)
      calculates the square of the length of the difference vector given by to(target)
      does not change the parameter
      double Vector3d.dotP(Vector3d v)
      calculates the dot-product of this and the parameter
      does not change both the parameter or this
      static double Vector3d.dotP(Vector3d a, Vector3d b)
      the dot product of two vectors is an double that can represent part of the angle between the parameters
      the dotP is positive if the angle between the vectors is pointed, a negative value otherwise
      if the parameter-vectors are orthogonal, the result will be 0
      it does not matter in which order the parameters are given
      static double Vector3d.getRatio(Vector3d a, Vector3d b)
      returns the ratio between the two given parallel vectors or Double.NaN if they are not parallel
      if given vectors a and b the ratio is defined as:
      a = ratio * b so that ratio = a / b;
      static boolean Vector3d.isFinite(Vector3d v)
      checks whether the given vector is not null and all it's coordinates are finite
      boolean Vector3d.isOrthogonal(Vector3d v)
      checks, whether the parameter-vector is orthogonal
      it may have another length
      boolean Vector3d.isParallel(Vector3d v)
      checks, whether the parameter-vector has the same direction
      it may have another length
      does not change the parameter
      boolean Vector3d.isSameOrientated(Vector3d v)
      checks, whether the parameter-vector has the same direction and orientation
      it may have another length
      does not change the parameter
      void Camera.lookInDirection(Vector3d dir, Vector3d up)
      the up-vector should be orthogonal to the direction-vector, otherwise the shading may be warped
      void Camera.lookTo(Vector3d target, double zoom, Vector3d up)
      sets focus to the specified target with zoom
      means look in direction towards the target
      a zoom-level under 0 means lookAway from target
      void Camera.lookTo(Vector3d target, Vector3d up)
      sets focus to the specified target with zoom=1d
      means look in direction towards the target
      void Camera.moveInAbsoluteDirection(Vector3d dir)
      the parameter-vector is along the constant x,y,z-axes
      void Camera.moveTo(Vector3d newpos)
      moves position and screen origin
      static void MatrixCalculation.mul(double[][] m, Vector3d vec)
      a faster way for a vector-instance to be multiplied and not to generate an array of its coordinates
      the matrixes dimension length has to be 3
      Vector3d Vector3d.multiply(Vector3d t)
      multiplies the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector3d Vector3d.rot(Vector3d axis, double rad)
      rotates this vector around the aligned axis in mathematically positive direction
      void Camera.rot(Vector3d axis, double rad)
      rotates the look direction around the constant given axis
      static double[][] MatrixCalculation.rotationMatrix(Vector3d axis, double rad) 
      Vector3d Vector3d.scaleTo(Vector3d compare)
      scales this vector to the length of the parameter-vector, but will not change this direction
      the parameter will not be changed
      Vector3d Vector3d.set(Vector3d t)
      copies the coordinates of the parameter to this
      does not change the parameter
      java.util.List<Vector2d> Shader.shade(Vector3d... vertices)
      shades all vertices
      java.util.List<Vector2d> Shader.shadeIgnoreMode(Vector3d... vertices)
      shades all vertices
      returns a pixel coordinate for every given vertex
      Vector2d Shader.shadeVertex(Vector3d vertex)
      shades a single vertex
      returns null if the vertex is not visible on the screen (does not correspond to the camera-mode-setting)
      Vector2d Shader.shadeVertexIgnoreMode(Vector3d vertex)
      shades a single vertex
      returns the screen-projection-position of it even if the vertex is out of bounds of the screen or false oriented
      returns never null
      Vector3d Vector3d.sub(Vector3d t)
      subtracts the coordinates of the parameter from the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter

      Vector3d Plate.nadirPoint(Vector3d point)

      the nadir point is that point on the plate that is shortest from the given point

      constructs a new point on the given location
      Straight(Vector3d s, Vector3d d)
      constructs a new straight, both parameters must be finite

      calculates the point that is on both this and the given line

      Vector3d Rectangle.nadirVector3d(Vector3d point)
      calculates the nadir point of the given point to this plate
      the nadir point is that point on the plate that is shortest from the given point
      the nadir point has not to be on the plate necessarily - in particular: contains(nadir point) does not need to return true

      aligns the direction as new normal
      lookInDirection calculates a rotation, the rotation-axis will be the crossProduct of currentNormal and newNormal (== given direction)

      Constructor and Description
      AdvTriangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c)
      calls this constructor, the normal vector will be orthogonal to this and normalized
      normal vector as the one of triangle3d
      AdvTriangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c, Color ambient, Color diffuse, Color specular, Color emissive, double shininess, Vector3d normal)
      call the super constructor
      sets a custom normal vector for lighting calculation
      for correct lighting the normal vector should be orthogonal to this and normalized
      AdvTriangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c, Material mat)
      call this constructor
      the normal vector will be orthogonal to this and normalized
      AdvTriangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c, Material mat, Vector3d normal)
      call the super constructor
      sets a custom normal vector for lighting calculation
      for correct lighting the normal vector should be orthogonal to this and normalized
      AdvTriangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c, Vector3d normal)
      call the super constructor
      sets a custom normal vector for lighting calculation
      for correct lighting the normal vector should be orthogonal to this and normalized
      to set ambient, diffuse and specular light colors and the shininess, direct access to the fields is permitted

      static Color ColorGen.fromVector(Vector3d vec)
      just copies the xyz-values to rgb, if the are in range of 0d to 1d
      if they are out of range they are constraint: all values over 1 are set to 1, all values under 0 are set to 0
